p: Extraction using pressurized ethanol was performed under similar experimental conditions as the one using subcritical propane. The experimental design results ( Table 1) showed that the highest yield (approx. 8%) was obtained at the central point (assays 5, 6 and 7). According to Table 1, the extraction using pressurized ethanol showed a lower yield than those using subcritical propane and organic solvent ( n-hexane), which could be due to a short-chain alcohol that did not present any good solvency for triglycerides under the applied conditions. Besides that, this process requires, after extraction, an additional step for ethanol removal via evaporation, which is seen as a disadvantage, since it may cause loss or damage to certain oil components.
